meanings.definition: A chemical substance produced and released into the environment by an animal, especially a mammal or an insect, affecting the behavior or physiology of others of its species.
meanings.sent1: The pheromones released by the ants helped guide the rest of the colony to the food source.
meanings.sent2: The dog used its pheromones to communicate with other dogs in the park.
meanings.sent3: The pheromones from the bees made the flowers dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The pheromones in the air whispered secrets to the waiting butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The pheromones in the forest created a symphony of scents that enchanted all who entered.

meanings.definition: A chemical substance used in communication between individuals of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The pheromones emitted by the queen bee directed the worker bees to the new hive location.
meanings.sent2: The pheromones of the wolves helped coordinate the pack's hunting strategy.
meanings.sent3: The pheromones at the party made everyone suddenly start dancing in sync.
meanings.sent4: The pheromones of the fireflies lit up the night sky with their silent conversations.
meanings.sent5: The pheromones of the fish led the others to the hidden underwater cave filled with treasures.
